Mr. Smirke; or, The divine in mode: being certain annotations upon the animadversions on The naked truth : together with a short historical essay, concerning general councils, creeds, and impositions, in matters of religion / by Andreas Rivetus, Junior, anagr. Res Nuda Veritas. Marvell, Andrew, 1621-1678.
[5], 40, [6], 41-76 [i.e. 82] p.
s.n.], [London? : Printed Anno Domini MDCLXXVI [1676]
In defence of The naked truth, by Herbert Croft, Bishop of Hereford, from the attacks of Francis Turner, Bishop of Ely, in his Animadversions upon a late pamphlet entituled The naked truth. Written by A. Marvell. Cf. Halkett & Laing (2nd ed.). First ed. Cf. NUC pre-1956. Place of publication from NUC pre-1956 imprints. Errata: p. [5] at beginning. Reproduction of original in Yale University Library.
=======
